caption.center: BROWARD BANK, A FLORIDA CORPORATION, N/K/A JEFFERSON BANK, PETITIONER, v.
DENVER SAMMONS AND JACQUELINE SAMMONS, RESPONDENTS.

court.center: District Court of Appeal of Florida, Fourth District.

opinion.posture: Petition for writ of certiorari to the Circuit Court for Broward County; Harry G. Hinckley, Jr., Judge.Page 734
opinion.attorneys:
G. Bart Billbrough, Walton Lantaff Schroeder Carson, Miami, for petitioner.
Robert T. Goodman, Robert T. Goodman, P.A., and Mark H. Shore, Mark H. Shore, P.A., Fort Lauderdale, for respondents.
opinion.opinion_text:
We grant certiorari and quash the trial court's order disqualifying petitioner's counsel in the civil action below. The circumstances simply do not give rise to any appearance of impropriety, much less to the kind of appearance warranting the drastic remedy of disqualifying a litigant's civil trial lawyer.
CERTIORARI GRANTED; ORDER QUASHED.
ANSTEAD, POLEN and FARMER, JJ., concur.
